statement.p:
Refer back to question
Is T one-to-one?
Is T onto?

ol.li: The transformation T is one-to-one if and only if A has a pivot in each column, which it does (it is already in row echelon form).
The transformation T is onto if and only if A has a pivot in each row, which it does not.

statement.p:
Let A be a square matrix and let T(x)=Ax. Which of the following guarantee that T is onto? (There could be multiple answers.)
T is one-to-one
Ax=0 is consistent
\Col A = \R^n
There is a transformation U such that T \cdot U(x) = x for all x
